oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James Hoover's shaped drainage channel
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stream channel which was improved by removing woody growth from both sides and sloping sides. Channel was shaped and seeded last month. Located nine miles northwest of Woodbury.

context One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Stream channelization
Photographic prints;
